Welcome to Xmara’s documentation!¶

Xmara service Contacts¶

contacts.views.birthday(request)¶

The birthday function takes the request and returns a rendered template of all contacts whose birthday is within the next 7 days.

Parameters:

request – Get the request object

Returns:

A list of contacts whose birthday is within 7 days from today

contacts.views.contacts(request)¶
The contacts function is used to create a new contact.

It takes the request as an argument and returns a rendered template with the form. If the method is POST, it will save the data from that form into our database.

Parameters:

request – Pass the request object to the function

Returns:

A response object

contacts.views.delete_contact(request, contact_id)¶
The delete_contact function deletes a contact from the database.
Args:

request (HttpRequest): The HTTP request sent to the server. contact_id (int): The primary key of the Contact object to be deleted.

Parameters:

  • request – Get the current user

  • contact_id – Identify which contact to delete

Returns:

A redirect to the main page

contacts.views.edit(request, contact_id)¶
The edit function is used to edit a contact.

It takes the request and contact_id as parameters. The function gets the user’s contacts from the database, then it creates an instance of ContactForm with that data, and if it is valid, saves it in the database and redirects to main page with a success message. Otherwise renders edit page.

Parameters:

  • request – Get the user information from the request object

  • contact_id – Get the contact object from the database

Returns:

A redirect to the main page

contacts.views.file_uploader(request)¶

The file_uploader function is responsible for uploading a CSV file to the server. It also saves the uploaded file in the database and then calls save_csv_to_model function, which saves all contacts from the CSV file to Contacts model.

Parameters:

request – Get the request from the user

Returns:

The rendered template

contacts.views.main(request)¶

The main function is the main view of the contacts app. It displays a list of all contacts for a given user, and allows them to be edited or deleted.

Parameters:

request – Get the request object that is sent to the server

Returns:

A render function

contacts.views.save_csv_to_model(file_path)¶

The save_csv_to_model function takes a file path to a CSV file and saves the data in that CSV file to the Contacts model. The function assumes that the first row of data in the CSV is a header row, so it skips over this row when saving each record. If an error occurs while trying to save any record, then all records saved up until that point are rolled back.

Parameters:

file_path – Get the path of the file

Returns:

A redirect object

contacts.views.search_contact(request)¶
The search_contact function is used to search for a contact in the database.

The function takes in a request object and returns either the main page or renders the search_contact template with context containing searched, contacts.

Parameters:

request – Get the request from the user

Returns:

The search_contact

contacts.views.sort(request)¶
The sort function is used to sort the contacts by first name.

It also paginates the contacts so that only 10 are shown per page.

Parameters:

request – Get the current request object

Returns:

A list of contacts ordered by firstname

Xmara service File manager¶

file_manager.views.delete_archive(request, archive_id)¶
The delete_archive function takes in a request and an archive_id,

finds the archive with that id belonging to the user making the request, deletes it from the database, and redirects back to where they came from.

Parameters:

  • request – Get the user from the request object

  • archive_id – Find the archive to delete

Returns:

A redirect to the previous page

file_manager.views.delete_audio(request, audio_id)¶
The delete_audio function deletes an audio file from the database.

It takes a request and an audio_id as parameters, then uses the Audio model to get the audio object with that id. The function then deletes that object and redirects back to where it came from.

Parameters:

  • request – Get the user from the request object

  • audio_id – Get the audio object from the database

Returns:

A redirect to the previous page

file_manager.views.delete_document(request, document_id)¶
The delete_document function deletes a document from the database.
Args:

request (HttpRequest): The request object sent by the user. document_id (int): The id of the document to be deleted.

Parameters:

  • request – Get the current user

  • document_id – Get the document that is to be deleted

Returns:

A redirect to the previous page

file_manager.views.delete_picture(request, picture_id)¶

The delete_picture function takes a request and picture_id as arguments. It gets the picture with the given id, which is owned by the user making the request, and deletes it. It then displays a success message to let them know that their picture was deleted successfully.

Parameters:

  • request – Get the current user

  • picture_id – Get the picture that we want to delete

Returns:

The redirect function which returns a httpresponseredirect object

file_manager.views.delete_video(request, video_id)¶
The delete_video function deletes a video from the database.
Args:

request (HttpRequest): The request object sent by the user. video_id (int): The id of the video to be deleted.

Parameters:

  • request – Get the current user

  • video_id – Identify the video that is to be deleted

Returns:

The http_referer

file_manager.views.download_archive(request, archive_url)¶

The download_archive function downloads the archive from the given URL and returns it as a response. The function takes an argument, which is a string containing the URL of an archive to download. The function returns a response object with content type set to ‘application/zip’ and Content-Disposition header set to attachment; filename=&quot;&lt;filename&gt;&quot;, where &lt;filename&gt; is extracted from the given URL.

Parameters:

  • request – Pass the request object to the view

  • archive_url – Get the url of the file to be downloaded

Returns:

A response object with the downloaded file

file_manager.views.download_document(request, document_url)¶

The download_document function is used to download a document from the server. It takes in a request and the URL of the document as parameters, and returns an HttpResponse object with the content of that file.

Parameters:

  • request – Pass the request object to the view

  • document_url – Specify the url of the document to be downloaded

Returns:

A response object with the content of the file and a header that tells the browser to download it

file_manager.views.download_image(request, image_url)¶

The download_image function takes a request and an image_url as arguments. It then makes a GET request to the image_url, gets the content-type from the response headers, and saves it in a variable called content_type. It also splits up the URL into its component parts using split(), and saves only the last part of that list (the filename) in another variable called filename. Then it creates an HttpResponse object with response’s content and our previously saved content type, sets Content-Disposition to attachment; filename=&quot;{filename}&quot;, and returns this new HttpResponse object.

Parameters:

  • request – Get the request object

  • image_url – Pass the image url to the function

Returns:

An image file with the specified url

file_manager.views.main_mf(request)¶

The main_mf function is the main view for the file manager. It renders a template with an avatar object, which is used to display the user’s profile picture in the top right corner of the page.

Parameters:

request – Get the user’s avatar from the database

Returns:

A render with the context of avatar

file_manager.views.pagination(request, files)¶

The pagination function takes in a request and a list of files. It then creates a paginator object with the number of items per page set to 20, and the list of files as its argument. It then gets the current page number from the request, and returns an object containing that page’s information.

Parameters:

  • request – Get the page number from the url

  • files – Pass in the queryset of files to be paginated

Returns:

A page object

file_manager.views.search_archive(request)¶
file_manager.views.search_audio(request)¶
The search_audio function is used to search for audio files in the database.

The function takes a request as an argument and returns a rendered template with the results of the search.

Parameters:

request – Get the request object from the view

Returns:

The result of the search for audio files

file_manager.views.search_document(request)¶
The search_document function is used to search for documents in the database.

The function takes a request as an argument and returns a rendered template with the results of the query. If there is no query, then it redirects to another page.

Parameters:

request – Get the request object

Returns:

The search_document

file_manager.views.search_picture(request)¶
The search_picture function is used to search for a picture in the database.

The function takes a request as an argument and returns the result of searching for pictures by title.

Parameters:

request – Get the request object

Returns:

The search_picture

file_manager.views.search_video(request)¶
The search_video function is used to search for videos in the database.

The function takes a request object as an argument and returns a rendered template with the results of the query. If there are no results, it redirects back to where it came from.

Parameters:

request – Get the request object from the view

Returns:

The following error:

file_manager.views.upload_archive(request)¶

The upload_archive function is responsible for uploading archive files to the cloud. The user can upload the following types of files: ‘zip’, ‘gz’, ‘tar’, ‘7z’.

Parameters:

request – Get the request object, which contains information about the current web request

Returns:

The archive upload page

file_manager.views.upload_audio(request)¶

The upload_audio function is responsible for uploading audio files to the cloudinary server. It also displays all of the uploaded audio files on a page.

Parameters:

request – Get the request object

Returns:

The file_manager/upload_audio

file_manager.views.upload_document(request)¶
The upload_document function is responsible for uploading documents to the cloud.

It also displays all uploaded documents on the page.

Parameters:

request – Get the request object

Returns:

A redirect to the same page

file_manager.views.upload_picture(request)¶

The upload_picture function is responsible for uploading a picture to the cloudinary server. It also displays all of the pictures that have been uploaded by the user.

Parameters:

request – Get the request object

Returns:

The render function

file_manager.views.upload_video(request)¶
The upload_video function is responsible for uploading a video to the cloudinary server.

It also displays all videos uploaded by the user on the same page.

Parameters:

request – Get the request object

Returns:

A render of the upload_video

Xmara service News¶

news.views.add_crypto_currency_to_file()¶

The add_crypto_currency_to_file function takes the crypto_currency_dict dictionary and writes it to a file called cryptocurrency_data.json

Returns:

None

Doc-author:

Trelent

news.views.add_currency_to_file()¶

The add_currency_to_file function takes the currency_dict dictionary and writes it to a file called ‘currency_data.json’

Returns:

A dictionary of currencies and their values

Doc-author:

Trelent

news.views.crypto_currency_parse()¶

The crypto_currency_parse function takes no arguments and returns a dictionary of the current exchange rates for the top 10 cryptocurrencies. The function uses the CoinAPI API to get the data, which is then parsed into a dictionary with each cryptocurrency as a key and its exchange rate as its value.

Returns:

A dictionary

Doc-author:

Trelent

news.views.currency_parse()¶

The currency_parse function takes the date_today variable and uses it to query the PrivatBank API. The response is then parsed into a dictionary with currency names as keys and exchange rates as values.

Returns:

A dictionary

Doc-author:

Trelent

news.views.home(request)¶
The home function is the main view of the website. It renders a template

with information about currency and crypto-currency rates, as well as news articles from various sources.

Parameters:

request – Get the request object

Returns:

A rendered template

Doc-author:

Trelent

news.views.news_prosport(request)¶

The news_prosport function is responsible for rendering the news_prosport.html template, which displays a list of short news from the prosport.ua website.

Parameters:

request – Get the request object, which contains information about the current web request

Returns:

A page with the news_prosport

Doc-author:

Trelent

news.views.news_prosport_show_one(request, _id)¶
The news_prosport_show_one function is used to show one news item from the Prosport website.

It takes a request and an id as arguments, then it gets the avatar of the user who made this request, reads currency info from file, gets short news list from tsn_prosport_spider function and finds a news item with given id in this list. If such an item exists it calls tsn_page_spider function to get detailed information about this particular article and renders one_prosport_news template with all necessary data.

Parameters:

  • request – Get the request object, which contains information about the current http request

  • _id – Identify the news item in the database

Returns:

The news_item, which is a dictionary

Doc-author:

Trelent

news.views.news_war(request)¶
The news_war function is a view that renders the news_war.html template,

which displays the short war news from tsn.ua website.

Parameters:

request – Pass the request object to the view

Returns:

The news_war

Doc-author:

Trelent

news.views.news_war_show_one(request, _id)¶

The news_war_show_one function is used to render the one_news.html template, which displays a single news item from the TSN website. The function takes in an id parameter and uses it to find a matching news item from the list of shortened news items returned by tsn_war_spider(). If there is no match, then not_found.html will be rendered instead.

Parameters:

  • request – Get the information about the current user

  • _id – Get the news item from the list of short news

Returns:

A response object

Doc-author:

Trelent

news.views.read_crypto_currency_from_file()¶

The read_crypto_currency_from_file function reads the cryptocurrency_data.json file and returns a dictionary of cryptocurrency data.

Returns:

A dictionary

Doc-author:

Trelent

news.views.read_currency_from_file()¶

The read_currency_from_file function reads the currency_data.json file and returns a dictionary of the data.

Returns:

A dictionary

Doc-author:

Trelent

news.views.tsn_page_spider(url, img_link, news_date)¶

The tsn_page_spider function takes in a url, img_link and news_date as parameters. It then makes a request to the url and parses the response using BeautifulSoup. The function then searches for all elements with class ‘l-page__main l-sheet l-sheet__gap .l-flex l-row .l-col

l-col–xl l-gap .carticle carticle__box’ within the soup object. It iterates through each of these elements, creating an empty dictionary called one_news_dict on each iteration. The function then searches for

Parameters:

  • url – Pass the url of the page to be scraped

  • img_link – Pass the image link to the tsn_page_spider function

  • news_date – Pass the date of the news to tsn_page_spider function

Returns:

A single dictionary

Doc-author:

Trelent

news.views.tsn_prosport_spider()¶

The tsn_prosport_spider function scrapes the TSN Prosport news page and returns a list of dictionaries. Each dictionary contains information about one article:

  • href (str): link to the article;

  • id (int): unique identifier of an article;

  • data_src (str): link to the image on the main page;

  • title (str): title of an article;

  • datetime(str) : time when an article was published.

Returns:

A list of dictionaries

Doc-author:

Trelent

news.views.tsn_war_spider()¶

The tsn_war_spider function scrapes the TSN.ua website for news articles related to the war in Ukraine, and returns a list of dictionaries containing information about each article.

Returns:

A list of dictionaries

Doc-author:

Trelent

news.views.war_stat_parse()¶
The war_stat_parse function takes the URL of a JSON file and returns a dictionary with two keys:

war_stats - A list of dictionaries containing the statistics for each ship type. war_increase - A list of dictionaries containing the increase in statistics for each ship type.

Returns:

A dictionary with two keys: war_stats and war_increase

Doc-author:

Trelent

news.views.war_statistic(request)¶

The war_statistic function is responsible for parsing the war_statistic.txt file and displaying it on the page.

Parameters:

request – Get the current user

Returns:

The war_statistic

Doc-author:

Trelent

news.views.when_bored(request)¶

The when_bored function is a view that returns the bored.html template, which displays an activity to do when bored.

Parameters:

request – Pass the request object to the view

Returns:

A rendered template

Doc-author:

Trelent

Xmara service Notes¶

notes.views.delete_note(request, note_id)¶
The delete_note function takes in a request and note_id,

then deletes the Note object with the given id. It redirects to ‘notes:main’ after deleting.

Parameters:

  • request – Get the user information from the request object

  • note_id – Find the note to delete

Returns:

A redirect to the main view

notes.views.detail(request, note_id)¶

The detail function is used to display a single note. It takes the request and the note_id as parameters, and returns a rendered template with the requested note. If no such note exists, it raises an Http404 exception.

Parameters:

  • request – Get the current user

  • note_id – Retrieve the note from the database

Returns:

A httpresponseredirect object

notes.views.edit_note(request, note_id)¶

The edit_note function is responsible for editing a note. It takes the request and note_id as parameters, gets the Note object with that id or returns 404 if it doesn’t exist, gets all tags of this user and checks if the request method is POST. If so, it creates a form from NoteForm class with the data from POST request and instance of edited note (note). If form is valid then we create an edited_note variable with data from form but without saving to database yet. Then we set its user attribute to current logged in user (request.user) and save it to database using .

Parameters:

  • request – Get the request object

  • note_id – Get the note object from the database

Returns:

The render function

notes.views.main(request)¶

The main function is the view for the main page of our site. It displays all notes and tags that belong to a user if they are logged in, or an empty list otherwise. It also paginates notes so that only 9 are displayed per page.

Parameters:

request – Get the current request object

Returns:

A render function

notes.views.note(request)¶

The note function is responsible for creating a new note. It first gets all the tags that belong to the user and passes them to the template. Then it checks if there was a POST request, which means that someone submitted data through our form. If so, we create an instance of NoteForm with this data and check if it’s valid (if all fields are filled correctly). If not, we render our template again but this time with errors in form fields (they will be highlighted). Otherwise we save our new note without committing changes yet because we need to add some tags first. Then we get all chosen tags from request body and

Parameters:

request – Get the data from the form

Returns:

The note

notes.views.search(request)¶

The search function takes a request and returns the search results. If there is no query in the request, it redirects to main. Otherwise, it filters notes by name or description and renders them.

Parameters:

request – Pass the request object to the view

Returns:

A list of notes that match the query

notes.views.set_done(request, note_id)¶

The set_done function takes a request and note_id as arguments. It then filters the Note objects by the primary key of note_id, and updates the done field to True. It then redirects to ‘notes:main’.

Parameters:

  • request – Get the user from the request object

  • note_id – Find the note that we want to mark as done

Returns:

A redirect to the main page

notes.views.sort(request)¶

The sort function takes in a request object and returns the search_results.html template with notes that have been filtered by tags selected by the user.

Parameters:

request – Get the request object

Returns:

A list of notes that have the selected tags

notes.views.tag(request)¶
The tag function is used to create a new tag.

It takes in the request and returns a rendered template of the form. If it’s a POST request, then it will save the data from that form into our database.

Parameters:

request – Get the current request object

Returns:

A redirect to the main page

Xmara service Scheduler¶

scheduler.views.start()¶

The start function is called by the scheduler.py file, which is run as a cron job every day.

Xmara service Users¶

class users.views.RegisterView(**kwargs)¶

Bases: View

dispatch(request, *args, **kwargs)¶

The dispatch function is a method that gets called when the view is requested. It checks if the user is authenticated, and if so redirects them to the home page. If not, it calls super().dispatch() which will call get(), post(), etc.

Parameters:

  • self – Refer to the current instance of the class

  • request – Get the request object, which is used to check if the user is authenticated

  • *args –

    Send a non-keyworded variable length argument list to the function

  • **kwargs –

    Pass keyworded, variable-length argument list to a function

Returns:

A redirect to the home page if user is authenticated, otherwise it returns a super()

form_class¶

alias of RegisterForm

get(request)¶

The get function renders the form to the user.

Parameters:

  • self – Access the attributes and methods of the class in python

  • request – Get the request object

Returns:

A render of the template_name with the form_class

post(request)¶
The post function is used to create a new user.

The form_class variable is set to the UserCreationForm class, which allows us to create a new user. The form variable is set equal to the post request and cleaned data from the UserCreationForm class. If the form has been filled out correctly, then it will save that information into our database and redirect you back

to login page with a success message.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the object itself

  • request – Pass the request object to the view

Returns:

The render function which renders the template

template_name = 'users/signup.html'¶

users.views.main(request)¶

The main function is the entry point for the view. It takes a request object as an argument and returns a response object.

Parameters:

request – Pass the request object to the view

Returns:

A render function, which is not a httpresponse object

users.views.profile(request)¶
The profile function is used to render the profile page of a user.

It takes in a request object and returns an HttpResponse object with the rendered template. The function also passes in context variables for use by the template.

Parameters:

request – Get the current user and their id

Returns:

A render object

users.views.question_to_ai(request)¶
The question_to_ai function is used to get a response from the OpenAI API.

The function takes in a request object and returns an HTML page with the user’s avatar and answer.

Parameters:

request – Get the user’s question from the form

Returns:

The answer_for_user variable

users.views.upload_avatar(request)¶
The upload_avatar function allows a user to upload an avatar image.

The function first checks if the request method is POST, and if so, it creates a form instance with the request.POST and request.FILES data (the latter of which contains information about uploaded files). If this form is valid, then we save it to our database using commit=False in order to delay saving the model until we’re ready to avoid integrity problems (see https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/2.0/topics/forms/#the-save-method for more info). We also assign this avatar’s user attribute

Parameters:

request – Pass the request object to the view

Returns:

A redirect to the profile page

users.views.user_data(request)¶

The user_data function renders the user.html template, which displays a list of all users in the database.

Parameters:

request – Pass the request object to the view

Returns:

The user
